Reviews.Title: “Decent place”
Reviews.Author: cxc-us
Reviews.Content: The place is quite decent. It is fairly clean albeit old look and feel, and pretty quiet (our room faces the inside, though). Two units share one bath, and each unit has its own faucet inside the room so you don't have to go the the shared bath for brushing teeth etc. Also there's a frig, but we unplugged to avoid the noise. Staff is very friendly and helpful. There's a free luggage storage service as well. You get a free drink ( tea or coffee) and a piece of pastry (bagel, muffin, or croissant) from the next door cafe. Only negative aspect is the size of the room, but consider this is New York City, and the room rates, it ain't that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Losing Ground”
Reviews.Author: P M
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Chelsea Inn several times over the past 10 years and am sorry to say it is slipping a bit. The carpet and top bed spreads simply need replaced or really cleaned. Replacing top bed spreads would be one cheap fix. The bath rooms were very clean and well kept as usual. I'm sorry but the sink in my room had several hairs in it. The staff has always been so friendly and helpful but the fun filled lady they have on week days now is about as passive aggressive as they come. (You're not doing anyone any favors by doing your job hon.) Check in after 5:30, she's moved on to bother other people elsewhere by then. With the recent increase in rates they are starting to compete at a level that offers better options. It is a great location though.

Reviews.Title: “Listed from the visit”
Reviews.Author: Jan W
Reviews.Content: A small but centrally located hotel. Positive side that it has internet, breakfast and there is a refrigerator. Negatively is that there are narrow stairs and no elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Homey and cozy!”
Reviews.Author: FrknCs
Reviews.Content: Small but clean rooms in the heart of Manhattan Midtown. GREAT location-wise and a nice breakfast -to-go.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget stay.”
Reviews.Author: Jillian M
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here if you are looking for a luxury stay in NYC, but if you are willing to cut some corners to save money, this place is wonderful. It seems like they took an apartment building and transformed it into an inn. The only issue we had was that the toilet broke the first night, but they had it fixed by the time we woke up the next morning. Sharing a bathroom with another room is not a big deal. When my mom and I stayed there, we never even saw the guy who shared it with us. Rooms are smaller, but the beds are very comfortable. There is a sink in the room, so you only have to go out to use the bathroom and shower. You get a free breakfast by way of a coupon for a bagel or pastry and coffee or tea for the cafe right next door. You can either get up and showered early, or (like we did) just throw on a coat and go get your breakfast before getting ready for the day. We took our breakfast back up to the room and then got ready as we ate it. The location is great. A very short walk to Union Square and two different subway stations that access most of, if not all, the major subways in Manhattan. Very safe and fun to stay at. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “HB x LM”
Reviews.Author: Epet_1984
Reviews.Content: I thought it was great, if you like characteristic, modest, "real" surroundings you'd think it too. I went to New York wanting to slot myself into the daily throes of the city and found it pretty easy when staying on 17th street, a great location for the kind of non-tourist tourist with equally good distances to the tourist-tourist stuff. Stayed on the top floor, warning about no lifts/elevators, it does make you breathy. Breakfast that's included is from the place just outside and IS a bagel/croissant, coffee/juice affair, but again, authentic - felt right walking out with the brown paper bag and coffee in hand. Besides if you're looking for more substantial breakfasts, visit the Belgian place next door for really fresh, lovely food. We would go there first, then use our breakfast "coupon" to get a bagel for later. I stayed in March/April when it was pretty cold, the rooms were really warm. There was some noise as you have to remember the Inn is wedged between commercial buildings but I didn't mind that, coming from London. This place was like a home away from home, cosy, light-hearted and not as shabby as some might say. For a place to crash, without stuffy hotel procedures it's perfect. I'd go again.

Reviews.Title: “A step above homeless”
Reviews.Author: Jewtah
Reviews.Content: Old, not so clean( the carpet was kind of scary) but i felt safe, and no bugs. The shared bathroom was fine. A convenient nighborhood, full of restaurants and bars and shopping. Easy to get to the subway. I think this is not your first or second or third choice but if this is the cheapest you can get you will survive. The television dated from the eisenhower administration! But the people were nice and the breakfast pastry and coffee was quite good...

Reviews.Title: “Clean, inexpensive, great location, complimentary ear plugs”
Reviews.Author: hogglebie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the Phish New Year's run 12/2011. When every other hotel in the city was $300+ a night, the Chelsea Inn came in at $170 a night. In the summer it is about $100. Parking was less than a block away for $45 a night. Our room was in the front of the building and on the 4th floor. I liked having the street right outside the window with a fire escape, so I could sit out there and be entertained by what went by, but I suspect the back rooms may be quieter. There are no elevators so if you suffer from any respiratory maladies, or a bum knee, you might want to think twice about staying here. We, on the other hand, love a good physical challenge and a reason to be thankful for packing light. Our room came with a small fridge (which was killer) and fire escape which was like a whole other room for me! After an initial investigation for bed bugs and critters (room very, very clean) we found these complimentary ear plugs. Hmmmmm.......The street is a bit noisy with commercial vehicles stopping on 17th street during the day and at night, a gay club crankin' downstairs called Splash. And Splash has a killer sound system. But we could not hear it on the 4th floor. I can't say the same for the 1st floor, but I just don't know. The folks at the Inn were real nice and we would definitely stay again - but know that the "breakfast" is a bagel OR muffin that is available next door, and you have to take it back to your room. Luckily for us, we partied so hard we didn't need the earplugs and we slep through breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal on a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Moth612
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located within walking distance of all kinds of great things, including the Chelsea Market, the Highline Park, Union Square, and all kinds of great shopping and little restaurants and such. It's got a small pub on one side and a gay club on the other. The Rubin Museum is just down the street and well worth a visit. The hotel itself has the kind of shabbiness that calls to mind an artist's garret. The rooms are small and oddly shaped, with mismatched furniture and many layers of paint on the wall. But it was clean clean clean, the staff were friendly and helpful, the guests were quiet. It's unbelievable how inexpensive this place is, especially if you are willing to share a (clean) bathroom with another room. BTW, there are several long-term parking garages within a 2 block radius, although no parking on site. The one thing to know: there are some serious stairs and no elevator. If this is a problem ask for a room on a lower floor. This place has a lot of character, and I'll definitely be back! I feel like I've been looking for this place in NYC for years.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value No Nonesense Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: oz_trav3ll3r
Reviews.Content: Had one of the upper floor rooms when I stayed here, a bit to cary the luggage but they had a luggage room so you don't have to carry everything with you. Friendly service and team. In the Chelsea district so easy walking district to the Village and Union Square areas. For around $100 or so a room I thought it was great value given location. My room was at the back so din't have any street noise issue. In any case the aircon was blowing so much that it acts like a white noise machine. Shared toilets is a compromise for me, but had no issues with neighbours. The bed can be a bit longer as I'm a taller guy but overall its a nice and cosy bed and breakfast type establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Hope You're a Sound Sleeper”
Reviews.Author: C R
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location near Union Square and many subway stops. Plenty to do within walking distance. If you plan to go out at night, then this is the place for you. If you plan to sleep and are a light sleeper, you may want to look elsewhere. There are no elevators so you have to lug your suitcase up flights of stairs. My business associate and I shared a bathroom but had separate sleeping quarters. The bathroom was a nice size and we each had a refrigerator, safe, and nice sized closet in the room. My only real complaint is the noise, which is not in management's control. They do supply earplugs, but between the karaoke bar, cabs honking, and general noise, getting a good night's sleep was a challenge.

Reviews.Title: “Chelsea Inn - perfect location, basic hotel with good rate.”
Reviews.Author: morrisandmoppet
Reviews.Content: My 2nd stay at the Chelsea Inn - I think it's great, perfect location and easy to find. The bathroom sharing is fine, I rarely found it occupied and it was always clean. Don't expect luxury as it isn't and nor is it advertised as such. It's a clean, basic hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: eurkd82
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed in a twin bed room for two nights at the beginning of september. The room faced the back and we found it quiet and easy to sleep. The room was clean and comfortable. No bugs or anything and the sheets and towels smelled and looked clean. I used to inspect hotels and I know where to look and this hotel was clean even in the hard to reach areas. The hotel staff was friendly and stored ours bags for us as we arrived very early. The instructions for how to use the safe are on the back of the closet door. The TV was small but it didn't matter because we weren't in NYC to watch TV! The bathroom was out of order everyday from around 10am to 4pm. I guess that must have been for cleaning but it was inconvenient. Otherwise the bathroom was clean. It is shared between two rooms so be aware if that isn't your thing. The location was great! SO close to several subway lines and not at all scary to walk around in the neighborhood at night. We returned after midnight one night and had no problems. The club next door was still open and we defiantely couldn't hear it from our room. The rooms air conditioning worked really well and seemed clean (didn't smell). The coffe and pastry in the morning was nice, even though there is no where onsite to enjoy it, Union Square is a short walk away. For the price and location I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good choice”
Reviews.Author: sivi987
Reviews.Content: The most important thing people should know is that is EXTREMELY NOISY; the web site should say something about it. - It is impossible to sleep; beside having one dancing club next door and one on the opposite side of the road, there are garbage trucks and trucks working on building next door all night starting around 2 am on and off until 6:30 am. It is really intense. The hotel is cheap, i agree with the gentleman who said that for the same money you can find a better place. Rooms in the web site are much, much nicer than what they really are. No elevator - 5 floors - not very well maintained - air conditioning not working. Bonnie and Rada, 2 of the receptionists have been sweet, while MIchelle, the "main " or "morning" receptionist - poor girl and really poor skills for attention to clients - basically mainly worried about following rules - asking to stay an extra 2 hours has become a major deal - such a place should have a much better attention to clients to compensate the quality of the rooms. the only good thing is the location - but , if you are looking at a place to stay in the area, keep looking, because unfortunately this place is not worth it

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Tip - Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: Des_traveller
Reviews.Content: Had the misfortune of staying here recently. I'm sure the manager is going to respond with the usual "We are a small independent Inn blah blah blah" whatever, this place is horrible. Rooms are from the 1940s. Air conditioning doesn't work. TV is tiny. Shared bathrooms (we were mislead about this). Wi fi doesn't work, no elevator. My recommendation? Stay in a good hostel where there'll be some banter - this place will spoil your NYC stay!

Reviews.Title: “Unclean”
Reviews.Author: SimonMacD
Reviews.Content: Although the staff was nice and the location was excellent, the hotel itself was a disaster. We were greeted in our tiny ground floor room by a cockroach. While this is no big surprise in an older building in lower Manhattan, he had a friend who showed up a day later: a large brown mouse (or small brown rat; either way, unacceptable). When it rained the shower drain, toilet, and sink all backed up filling the bathroom with a foul smelling black sludge. Unsettling at 2:30 am, to say the least. we brought all of these details to the attention of the management and they assured us that it was normal (?!). For $225CAD per night it was a terrible deal. One bright spot: it did have a nice free breakfast option from the cafe it was associated with.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I wanted”
Reviews.Author: MEM1980
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exactly the right make up of price, location and comfort. NYC is expensive and I've stayed in hotels across the gamut. From hostels to five star depending on the occasion and stage of my life. But this place is perfect for a trip to NY. The hotel is an old building that used to serve as apartments. So you get the real experience of living in NY, not just visiting. It is a walk up, but thats part trade off with price, location and charm. The staff is friendly and available during normal hours. The location is pefect. Close to subways, Union Sq, Greenwich Village, Madision Sq Park, High Line, etc. The price is reasonable. And the rooms are small but comfortable and clean. The room I stayed in shared a bath with one other room but I never saw the other guests. One downside is no common space, but thats to be expected. There is always the restaurant next door with a back patio to use as a meeting place. Afterall, the hotel is a place to hang your hat and rest, not sit around and watch tv. There is too much to do in NY to waste time sitting in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location For Chelsea Stay”
Reviews.Author: HiSFtraveller69
Reviews.Content: We stay here for NYC gay pride 2011. The hotel was a townhouse style, 2 rooms shared a bathroom, which was fine, for the 4 days we were there, we never bumped into the other room for the bathroom. The room was equipped with a refrigerator (which i was pleasantly surprised that they had one). The free coffee and pasteries was a nice touch. The room was clean, the bathroom was nicely remodeled. The location you could note beat, we were half a block from the parade (nice for bathroom breaks), next to Splash (the other reviews said they could hear the noise, but we didn't). For the price and the location of being in chelsea, you can't beat it...

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located but shared bathrooms.”
Reviews.Author: citymouse7
Reviews.Content: You are certainly ideally located staying here. The people at the front desk were pleasant though it was a bit confusing which door to initially enter. There are shared bathrooms, a fact I did know as a friend actually booked the reservation. It's not generally my preference. The bathroom was clean and seemed to be shared by two rooms. The only issue is there was no fan or other outside ventilation so steam built up and there were some spots of mold close to the ceiling. The surfaces were clean but bring shower shoes. There was a sink, mirror and hair dryer in the room. There was also an AC in the window which helped with the heat and also noise. You do get vouchers for free breakfast at the location downstairs from the Inn. It's a pastry, coffee or tea and fruit or juice.

Reviews.Title: “Think Twice”
Reviews.Author: hihi_11
Reviews.Content: I would never recommend this place, you get what you pay for. I arrived late and the man who checked us in was so rude, he made it obvious we disturbed him. If you leave your luggage they have you put it under a staircase and anyone has access to it. Of course they tell you they are not responsible for anything lost or stolen, but naturally they won't tell you this when you book your stay, they tell you that there is a place for luggage. There are no dead bolts on most of the doors, and when I complained the night manager screamed at me and told me to stay someplace else.(I tried, but every place was booked unless I wanted to pay 400.00) They do have internet access but on the higher floors you can't get a good signal and I had to find a starbucks for internet connection. No elevators and the bed was equal to sleeping on a board. (and I like hard beds) I reserved a room with two single beds and got a double. The continental breakfast was a ticket to go to a little shop next door and the food and coffee were awful. There were no healthy choices but an old apple, unless you call a juice box healthy. Also this place is a long way to a subway, location was really bad. I would never recommend it, unless you are totally desperate.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER STAY HERE!!!! DIRTY, SMALL, LOUD, UNPROFESSIONAL STAFF!!!”
Reviews.Author: ldelaney
Reviews.Content: I am writing to express my DEEP dissatisfaction with my stay at the Chelsea Inn. My stay lasted from May.14th 2011-May.18th 2011. I chose to stay at the Chelsea Inn due to its location and reasonable prices. Another deciding factor for my choice was the flexibility and the ability of the staff to accommodate my needs via the phone before my arrival. However, when I arrived this was simply NOT the case. I requested two beds on my reservation. I knew it was a long shot, but I added this as a comment in my reservation. I received an email stating that there would only be one double bed. So the next day, I called to make sure that there was the possibility of having two beds. The reason being, that I was sharing a room with my father and sharing a bed was something both of us were not comfortable with. I spoke with a gentleman with an accent who stated that this would be possible and that he would write a comment to make sure that it happened. If this had not been the case, we certainly would have explored further options. When my father and I arrived on the 14th the gentleman at the front desk went frantically looking for another room with another bed, but upon his return, apologized and stated that if we could excuse him this one night, he would compensate us (a measly $10.00) and that tomorrow it would be taken care of. As uncomfortable as it was, we slept in the same bed the first night. However, the second night of our stay we had heard nothing about the second bed. So when we called the front desk they sent a maid upstairs. She came with a less than desirable roll away. The problem besides the comfort with the roll away was that logistically it would not have been possible to fit in the room we were in. If we put it at the front of our room it would have been blocking the door which not only is a fire hazard but inconvenient in that we both use the restroom during the night. Obviously, none of these choices sounded comforting to my father or I. So needless to say, for four nights my father and I shared a double bed. A few more things that were less than desirable were the fact that it was not made aware to us before our stay that there is a nightclub right outside of our window that shook our room and kept us from sleeping as well as construction that kept us up as well. Additionally, on our first night at the inn, our restroom was out of order for a couple of hours. In all, both my father and I agree that this was the worst experience that we have had when staying in a hotel or inn. Aside from all of this, the most inconvenient occurrence was that of being charged TWICE for my stay which resulted in my account being overdrawn and not having money for the last two days of my NYC vacation. It also appears that some of the rooms are residences as well. I WOULD NEVER RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL TO ANYONE! PAY THE 50$ EXTRA TO STAY SOMEWHERE NICER. IT WILL BE VERY WELL WORTH IT. IF YOU WANT CLEANLINESS, TO BE CHARGED THE CORRECT AMOUNT, A GOOD NIGHTS SLEEP, WORKING BATHROOMS, AND ACCOMMODATING STAFF DO NOT STAY AT THE CHELSEA INN!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting and Soooo noisy”
Reviews.Author: Metak1
Reviews.Content: Hotel right next to a night club, splash bar, check it out on the net. Â All night, every night, music was thumping through our bedroom. Â Drunk people in streets, doors banging, cars speeding past. Â We did not get much sleep, leaving little energy for site seeing. Â Constant smoke drifting through the windows and doors, we were at times scared. Â Cleaners left dirty sheets on the bed. Â Floors not vacuumed, evidently dirty floors. Â Yes perfect location, but at the cost of no sleep, constant passive smoking and noise, not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and switch on gift certificate”
Reviews.Author: NYUParent
Reviews.Content: We received a gift of a night at Chelsea Inn. When I called to book the room, I was told that they have a 2-night minimum on weekends. This restriction is mentioned absolutely nowhere on the gift certificate. We won't be able to use this gift and I feel especially badly for the very kind people who gave it to us, who I am sure would not have made this purchase had the restriction been disclosed to them.

Reviews.Title: “My Experience was Unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: edinm
Reviews.Content: We booked with Thomas Cook but it turns out they booked through Expedia. The hotel staff could not locate our booking and implied we had been conned. Repeatedly telling us that he had "never heard of Thoms Cook, we've never dealt with them and I've been here 5 years". He had no suggestions about what we could do but made it fairly clear he wasn't interested in helping us. We asked to use the phone and he wasn't very happy about it. Eventually another memeber of staff came past, he asked her and she located the booking. He would have turned us away. The room was basic, we weren't expecting luxury. It was up over 100 very steep stairs which creaked and were clearly very old, I found it quite scary. The bed was rock solid, very difficult to sleep on and I actually woke up in pain a few times. The radiator made loud bangs randomly through the night. Somebody kept smoking in the shared bathroom and leaving ash and fag ends everywhere too. Our room was extremely dusty. The whole place was just really rundown and in urgent need of some refurbishment. I've not got amazingly high standards, especially for what we paid but I did expect more than this. We asked staff for directions and they directed us 5 blocks away from the actual place, we were looking for the Lion King Theatre which is huge and well known and on Times Square!! As foreigners we didn't know but surely local staff would know! We stayed for New Year and on our way back discovered the hotel was next to a gay bar. Not something that would bother me at all but the people standing outside this particular one were intimidating and there were not very nice things going on in public. There was a used condom on the hotel steps.... My luggage was lost and everyday I checked with the hotel to see if it had arrived, they always said no. On the mast day I checked out, went to store our bags in the cupboard and lo and behold there was my case!! I asked reception why nobody had told me and how long it had been there, she got very annoyed and looked at some random piece of paper before announcing it had arrived very late last night and they didn't want to wake me so had left a note on my room door.... this would be an invisible note then? So I then had to repack in the hallway. Who knows how long it had actually been there, the tag showed it had arrived in New York 4 days previously anyway. We were asked how our stay had been we said "ok" clearly not wanting to elaborate but she pushed us asking "just Ok? Why not good?" I merely mentioned the radiator as I couldn't be bothered realing off the list of irritating things that had happened. I was told with an angry tone that I should have said something and we could have moved rooms. This is a lesson learned for me but in a fully booked hotel over New Year I'm not sure how they would have managed that. Perhaps they have invisible rooms to go with invisible notes. In general, it's a good location for exploring New York and cheap. It would do if you're on a budget. However, staff extremely rude and unhelpful, bed like rocks and loud clanging radiator which almost induced a heart attack at 3 am. Polite, helpful staff don't cost extra, it may be cheap but there's no excuse for such poor service.

Reviews.Title: “This place is clean central and cheap for manhattan with Great staff”
Reviews.Author: pdcutie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the staff was awesome lost my wallet and they never charged me fof long distance phone calls and let me use the computer. verry clean nice rooms at a reasonable price for the area close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect temporary "home"”
Reviews.Author: ANewsom1980
Reviews.Content: The location is PERFECT and very quaint. We had a first floor room, which was lovely. I would hate to have to climb the stairs - they were incredibly narrow. BUT this is a "budget" hotel and I imagine you get used to the stairs. Below is a nice little bakery from which guests receive a very basic continental breakfast (better than nothing, if you ask me). Our room had 2 twin beds. Both were clean and comfy. The bathroom was larger than I expected. The room itself was small, but really - the room is where I spend the least bit of my time in the city. My main complaint is there is a club next to the hotel and if your room backs up to it, you will hear the thumping into the wee hours of the morning. However I took ear plugs and was just fine. I'd also recommend stopping by Petite Abeille, a wonderful little Belgian cafe next door. Carlos was our waiter and he was perfect. The location was great - lots of restaurants, bars, and easy access to subway and cabs.

Reviews.Title: “For the price, this is as good as you can expect in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Quebermuda
Reviews.Content: For what worked out to $133/night including tax, we had an amazing location in Manhattan, nice and helpful staff, a smallish but reasonable and well-heated room, a somewhat comfortable bed, a clean bathroom that we shared with one other room, and a danish/apple/cup of tea breakfast. Unless you're willing to spend $200+, you're not going to do much better than that in south Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Good value accommodation without compromising on comfort”
Reviews.Author: RothburyLady
Reviews.Content: We chose Thanksgiving to visit New York City and quickly discovered availability of economic rooms was quickly diminishing but fortunately found the Chelsea Inn. Reviews were mixed but we found the room was adequately equipped with coffee making, fridge, a (unnecessary) desk & chair and a good sized bed tucked into the back of the room albeit rather small. The bathroom was small but very clean. Reception was friendly and provided a cupboard for left luggage. The friendly bakery beneath the hotel served excellent pastries, juice, tea & coffee for breakfast. The location was great - not too far from the subway, close to Union Square (great brewery pub/food) and 20mins from Penn station / start of downtown. In dry weather, we walked into town each day and south to the Statue area. Tip: we did not visit the statue because of the lengthy queues so we took the free ferry to Staten Island and took pictures. Since all the roads were busy streets, we felt very safe and did not encounter problems, even at night on the subway, in the bustling Indian district, or in Harlem (in daylight). This was a nicely located place to stay in a busy city at a popular time of year but without disturbance.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: SkootGolightly
Reviews.Content: I stayed there the week before christmas for work and enjoyment. its a great location with helpful staff. housekeeping was awsome: i worked one night till 4am and didn't go out the next day till well after 2pm and they still made sure my room was freshened. pretty much everything anyone complains about here can be fixed....but i think people like to complain so even though they read these things, they don't bother to inquire. comfortable, clean, very roomie. cute! charming historic ny! they'll be getting all my buisness!! xo skoot

Reviews.Title: “Pictures and description on the website are not lived up to in reality”
Reviews.Author: mudlark026
Reviews.Content: We had booked for 6 nights but left after the first. The rooms, although re-painted were very old and seemed to have been furnished from local second-hand markets. The bed was most uncomfortable. There is no lobby or lounge to hang out in. No bar, no breakfast room. You are either in your narrow room or else outside somewhere. Alarm bells were ringing when the staff asked us to pay in advance before we had even climbed the 4 flights of stairs and inspected the room! I had to turn sideways to pass between the end of the bed and the wall. The plumbing clanked all night and the toilet did not flush. Friendly staff but we found much better accommodation at Washington Square and paid less than they were asking at Chelsea Inn

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, good location, but noisy.”
Reviews.Author: mkabell
Reviews.Content: The two biggest assets for this hotel is price and location. For the price offered, you can't go very far in NYC - and noone can complain about neither cleanliness nor the size of rooms for this price level. Breakfast is served by the cafÃ© in the lower level - quite okay, but also a bit dull if you stay more than a couple of days. We had the impression that the staff cleans the common areas very often, which especially for the shared restrooms and showers are very nice. On the other hand, some fresh air would be great once in a while. You really can't open windows, and it seems like that noone refreshens the air inside the hotel - using chemical airfresheners just isn't the same! I would stay here again - especially if they get some hold of the noise from the outside and from the pipes that were clanging a lot (but which, it should be mentioned, were dutifully noted when we mentioned it to the reception).

Reviews.Title: “Cheery budget option in Meat Packing District”
Reviews.Author: Traveliciou5
Reviews.Content: The Chelsea Inn isn't 'posh' but it is clean, warm, well-located, cheerfully decorated and very good value for NYC. For half the price of similar looking hotels, we got a cosy room with comfy quilted bed, a nice free breakfast from the lovely bakery downstairs and a clean well-appointed bathroom (shared, but with only one other person.) Just a few blocks from the Subway and with free luggage storage and wireless, this is perfect for a couple on a budget who are prepared to forgo a few '5-star' creature comforts to save hundreds of dollars.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: ttoronto
Reviews.Content: We only paid $119 per night and in NYC, that's practically free, so I wasn't expecting much. Location was great - very central. The staff were nice. A few things that didn't impress me: The bathroom. The trap thing in the sink had a bunch of hair and soap hunger in it. I removed the trap and placed it on the floor, where it remained for the rest of our three night stay. The light switch was encrusted with dirt, which left me to wonder about the cleanliness of the rest of the room. The sheets on me bed were clean but quite badly torn. The NOISE from the street was unbelievable. I know it's New York. But there is a club a few doors down with loud patrons that yelled all night. Trucks that made deliveries at 4 am. The windows in the hotel are so thin we thought they were open. If you do stay here make sure your room doesn't face the street. We barely slept. Don't think I would stay here again. Not horrible but when I'm out walking all day I need a decent nights rest.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a 1 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TandCfromHawaii
Reviews.Content: Pros: Convenient to get a taxi, folks at the front desk seem very helpful and friendly. Cons: hotel is very old and could stand to have a bit of updating and the street side rooms are VERY noisy at night. The bathroom was very clean and updated tho, which was nice. The bedroom was SMALL, the bed very sagged and uncomfortable. The breakfast was a little disappointing (just one cold pastry, a Capri Sun drink, and a coffee or tea), we walked around the block to the City Bakery instead. The price, however, is very reasonable and the folks who man the desk out front are pretty helpful with advice, they helped us out with how to get to/from the airports, etc. The worst part of staying here was that there is a bar right next door. It gets EXTREMELY loud between 2am and 4am so if you can, avoid the street front rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: Gemnod
Reviews.Content: Well what can i say but thank you all at chelsea inn for making our first trip to new york so much better. From moment me and my fiance arrived they were curteous, helpfull, friendly etc . Cant wait for next trip and will stay in chelsea inn .will recomend to friends and family also. We were bit sceptical about shared bathroom but it was never a problem and was also clean.thanks chelsea inn from michael and gemma

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: peggv
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a girlfriend for three nights. Great location. Friend lost her wallet first night and hotel staff were amazingly helpful in contacting police, finding bank phone numbers to cancel cards etc. Room was spotless, and beds very comfortable. Only shared a bathroom with one other room, and never saw that person! Will definitely stay here again! Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: MelissaBazley
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 8 nights. We really enjoyed ourselves. The rooms were clean & cosy (we stayed in 3 different rooms as we had friends come to stay with us, so needed bigger room). The rooms at the back of the hotel would be my pick. They are nice and quiet so you can get a good sleep. Rooms at the front can be noisy on weekends due to nearby night club. We had no problem with sharing a bathroom. We found the staff to be VERY helpful and friendly and they couldn't do enough to make our stay happy. The location is brilliant; close to several subway stations, plenty of excellent restaurants and diners, a laundromat, great shopping and Union Square. What more could you ask for ? We have already recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location; wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: iztehtravelbug
Reviews.Content: I booked myself a private suite (with a private bath) at Chelsea Inn, and am very glad I made that choice. This place is a hidden gem! While it was fairly pricier as compared to their other rooms, but it's one of the most inexpensive places in Manhattan. Overall, I loved the old look of the room - it was small (in a charming way - not so small that a normal-sized person cannot fit in there) and very cozy. The good: Convenient location. I loved the fact that three (maybe four??) subway stations are within reasonable walking distance from this place. A lot of major clothing brand stores are nearby as well. My room: First of all, it smelled AWESOME! It looked very very clean. Couldn't ask for better lighting in both bedroom and washroom. I adored the photography on my walls. The bed itself was very comfy and clean! Service: Everytime I turned to the front desk, there was a different person. So I talked to at least five different staff members. The staff at Chelsea Inn has to be the friendliest group of people I found in Manhattan. The bad: Nothing to do with Chelsea Inn itself, but the bar next door can get really loud at night. I returned to my room after midnight. Good thing I was dead tired, so I didn't really stay awake for too long to deal with the noise of people just outside my window. The ugly: Nothing! =) I absolutely loved my stay at Chelsea Inn and will definitely return to this place on my next visit to NYC. On a scale of 1 to 10, I give Chelsea Inn an 11!! Thanks, everyone, for your hospitality... You guys are the best! Until next time...

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and met my needs”
Reviews.Author: cindyann15
Reviews.Content: When I travel, a hotel is a place to keep my luggage and a nice place to sleep. This definitely met my needs. It was close to subways, nice restaurant next door - cute coffee shop below the hotel. Clean, friendly staff. There is shared bathroom - however, it is shared with one other room, fortunately for me, the other room was empty. I liked it and would definitely return

Reviews.Title: “My favorite play to stay in the city.”
Reviews.Author: owenmean
Reviews.Content: I love this place - very cozy and a great bargain. It doesn't have all the amenities (room service, etc.) if that's important to you but it is clean, comfortable, reasonable, and in a great location. You do need to let them know if you are arriving late because the front desk closes, but there is someone to buzz to get you a key, etc. It doesn't have an elevator (part of its charm) so if you are out of shape getting to the 4th floor would be hard. It's not for everyone but I love it......and I'm 57!

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: venay
Reviews.Content: Beware: the front desk closes at 9:00 pm, so if you are arriving late, you will NOT be able to check in. The whole place closes down at 9:00 PM. You will not even get in the front door. All the contact information that they provide is not in service: the phone number is out of service and there is no one to buzz you in. We stayed here with friends who arrived late from the west coast. To get into their room, we had to wake up the security man who was sleeping on the fifth floor. There was no one at the front desk until after 9:00 am, so our friends still did not have a key to her room. Without a key, they had to leave the door unlocked to go next door for breakfast. The other problem is that the wireless internet does not work. The staff person says they will fix it, but never do. The only good thing I can say about this hotel is that it is next door to the Petite Abeille Restaurant. We waited for our friend to arrive there. The waiters were friendly and accommodating-- and the wireless internet works there. I would return to the Petite Abeille, but not the Chelsea Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Only if you're desperate”
Reviews.Author: flood81
Reviews.Content: Agree completely with Alinks...you should only consider staying here if it's substantially cheaper than everything else and you absolutely cannot afford to pay more. I was expecting more from the reviews...can't believe that 68% of people would have recommended this place. However, the location is really very good. I quite enjoy the European style hotel with shared bathrooms and such, but the bathroom on our particular floor was always filthy. I felt uneasy taking a shower every morning. One morning I actually went and showered on another floor because it was a bit more acceptable, but I don't think I was supposed to do this. There is no soap provided in the shared bathrooms so you have to walk to your room to wash your hands after using the bathroom...a bit of an inconvenience. The rooms are like dungeons, cramped and dreary. They do not look clean and I always expected to see a cockroach or a rat. Walking up five flights of stairs several times a day is a bit much after pounding the pavement exploring the city. The bed linens are ratty and I think changing this alone would spruce the place up a lot. The safe doesn't seem to work properly. Also, one day the maid left our room unlocked and didn't fully close the door. I was relieved nothing was stolen. However, when I told the front desk about this they were very apologetic. No complaints about breakfast. It's true, there is nowhere for you to eat but at least the coffee and pastries are decent. You can go eat in Washington Square which is far better anyway. The woman working in the bakery was quite pleasant. Finally, the price paid was not at all reasonable for the calibre of the hotel. My friends stayed at Hotel 17 after checking out of this hotel and it was available for less money despite being far superior in pretty much every way. I would also recommend waiting to book a few days before unless there is a major event going on in NY at the time. We booked this place too far in advance and paid far too much.

Reviews.Title: “What a disaster - travellers beware!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: pamelaNewZealand
Reviews.Content: Absolute disaster start to our first-ever trip to NY. Turned up at hotel after a long flight from UK, only to be told they believed our stay was to have begun the night before, and, due to this, had charged us full whack for not turning up - and - were now fully booked with other patrons so had no room for us. it was obviously the hotel's mistake - and, luckily, i had all the email correspondence to prove it. the staff member VERY begrudgingly allowed me to print these off to "prove" that i had in fact booked the correct dates and had turned up at the right time. i printed all the emails off and showed them to both staff members who were both dismissive and rude and said they were 'very surprised' by the emails and that they were slightly suspicious about the fact that they were signed off by 'the chelsea inn team' and not a direct staff member. etc etc etc. the story goes on - to cut a long one short - we had no where to stay, no apology and no offer of accommodation elsewhere. NEVER NEVER NEVER book with these guys. it' a mickey mouse operation and - while i was disputing my accomm arrangements - a deeply dissatisfied patron turned up at the front desk to ask why the hotel's wi-fi was STILL not working - after a 24 hour period he was back to find out - only to be told that one of the staff "must have forgotten" to reboot the system. just embarrassing level of customer service - and complete ineptitude. don't bother - so many other great options in NY at a reasonable price - save yourself the stress - and the attitude of this place - and stay elsewhere!! the chelsea savoy up a few blocks was where we ended up and couldn't have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly and accommodating staff”
Reviews.Author: JanenClare
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Chelsea Inn in one of the ground floor double rooms. The bed was comfy and the room was clean. We were slightly concerned by the provision of earplugs but despite some background city noise the room was reasonably quiet and easy to sleep in. The Inn is ideally located for a variety of areas (Meatpacking, Greenwich Village, 5th avenue etc) and close to a variety of subway stations. Some might be put off by the breakfast arrangements (from the bakery underneath the hotel that has no seating area) but the pastries and the coffee were fresh and worked well for us.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: lyceumDC
Reviews.Content: The rooms are quaint, cozy, and very clean. NO BED BUGS! My wife and I found the staff to be polite and very helpful. The location is great (situated between Chelsea and the Villages). If you plan on visiting New York just to hang out in your hotel room all day, then perhaps the Chelsea Inn is not for you. On the other hand, if you are a value and location-conscious traveler, then I highly recommend this hotel. I will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: lovetofly0
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research, the reviews for this hotel were mostly positive, and I am happy to report I also had a positive experience. The room was tiny, but we didn't need anything big. The staff were all so incredibly nice and helpful. We felt safe and comfortable, and breakfast was great! All for a great price! Thankyou!

Reviews.Title: “A real New York feeling”
Reviews.Author: AlexieMontreal
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at the Chelsea Inn during my last trip to New York City and was very pleased by my stay. Since I live in Montreal, I like going to spend a long week-end in NY here and there, and I've been to different kinds of hotels. This was my best experience. Since New York is very pricey, we were happily pleased by the very reasonable prices for such a great neighbourhood (right between Chelsea and Greenwich Village). Our lovely and large room with queen size bed was perfectly clean and neat and very confortable. Since we agreed on sharing a bathroom with only one room next door (which caused no problem at all), we were charged 109$/night, breakfast included. For NY, this is quite amazing. Of course, you have to be ok with the bathroom sharing thing. What I liked to most, aside from the cheap rates, the service and the lovely staff, was the feeling to that place. Kind of vintage without actually trying to be. The feeling you get is that the place has not been redecorated since the 70's. The bed seemed new, we had Air Con and all those facilities (fridge, flat tv, etc.) but the looks were very dated, which we found charming. The stairs crack a lot and by the windows, you see habitations and backstreets in bricks and that kind of stuff. You know, the New York feeling. I strongly recommand it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: KimberlyMKA
Reviews.Content: Our daughter is a freshman at Parsons The New School and we needed to move her in to her dorma nd participate in parent activiites so thsi hotel was perfect location wise and a good value. The rooms were clean, NO BED BUGS, and the satff was pleasant and helpful. I would stay here again however would ask for a room in the back of the building since the "active night life" kept us up.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: szenack
Reviews.Content: The staff was helpful and accommodating. Room was adequate for our needs and larger than we expected. Everything was clean. Location is great, very good value for NYC. Our only complaint was a few mosquito bites but folks left the bathroom window open....not the hotel's fault. A good stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly careworn/shabby (in a cute way) but clean, great location and good value.”
Reviews.Author: yamyamboy
Reviews.Content: A very cute B&B-type hotel with lots of 'character' (interpret how you will) in an amazing location for the price. Staff were mostly friendly and helpful, although I had some problems with phone/internet (wi-fi signal non-existent at back of building). Very quiet, given raucous nightlife in the neighbourhood. I shared a bathroom with one other room, but this was absolutely fine. Breakfast (from Nana's Treats downstairs) is the most minimal you can imagine (tiny box of juice, coffee/tea, one pastry) - only needs a cigarette to qualify as an authentic French breakfast - but is good nonetheless. Would definitely stay again and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Unpretentious but comfortable, good service, location and value”
Reviews.Author: Lucentio
Reviews.Content: I can't think of anything to complain about; my room was spacious (for one person) , clean and comfortable (A/C, fridge, wireless, good lighting, basic TV, sink, large closet, lots of towels, hairdryer borrowed from the desk) and I was never aware of the presence of the person with whom I shared a bath. The staff bent over backwards to assist me with every question and request. If I were on a honeymoon and/or had paid 4 or 5 times as much, I might impose a higher standard and miss a swimming pool, gym and 24 hour room service. As it is, I was happy to spend that money on good restaurants and theatre. I would recommend The Chelsea Inn to my thrifty or unpretentious friends.

Reviews.Title: “It's a dump”
Reviews.Author: ekkekko
Reviews.Content: Very simply it's a dump. Made the reservation because I had an appointment nearby. Biggest mistake I ever made. The place needs to be torn down. If anyone believes it is decent then they must live in a cave. Stayed the one night because I didn't want to loose a night's charge but then prompty left the next day. The web-site is very misleading.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and Decent in a Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: SofiaLeRed619
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Chelsea Inn because it was literally one of the cheapest accommodations in Manhattan and it is in a great location right next to the Chelsea area. We had considered staying further away in Brooklyn to get more for the money, but we were only in the city for a few days so we wanted the Manhattan experience. Our room was very cute and comfortable. It was very very small and we even laughed at the fact that my husband, who is 6'4", could touch both sides of the room while stretching out in bed. However, the rooms have really high ceilings and so it does not feel claustrophobic at all. The room was very long and had lots of room for our bags so we did not feel cramped. And as we were visiting in winter, we really appreciated that the heating was warm and comfortable at all times. Our room faced the inner courtyard and thus was very quiet, but I believe that the rooms on the street side may have been nosier. The bathroom was separate, but they have one designated for every floor and it was extremely clean for a shared bath. I did not even feel the need to wear shower shoes. All in all, we would definitely stay here again if we were on a budget in New York City.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: Quinn67
Reviews.Content: nice location and a great value. Simple and clean, the service was good. The room was small but a perfect size for no more than 2. It has a small sink in it which is nice for the rooms that share a bath room. My room was on the street side and it was a bit noisy but that is NYC. The best thing was location and value. Great place.

Reviews.Title: “This Inn is the "IN" Place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: wrightonover
Reviews.Content: Michelle welcomed us upon arrival. Very Helpful!!! Great room with shared bath. Very Clean. Near restaurants like Eleven Madison and Tabla. Stroll through Madison Square Park (Where the statue of Liberty was assembled), Jazz Standard (4-stars!!!), 55 Bar, Adorama-For photo/electronic geeks, & all oh so many paper places for journaling & Scrapbooking. CHELSEA INN ROCKS!!!

Reviews.Title: “ok.. but know what you are getting.”
Reviews.Author: BELL48848
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and desk help were very pleasant. When we made the reservation, the male attendent asked what time our flight was landing. We stated around 12:30p.m.. When we finally arrived at 2:30... our room was ready and waiting for us. The female desk attendent, originally told us it wasn't and we would have to store our lugguage under the stairway. After a couple of questions, she 'finally' checked, and found our room was ready. Saved us a couple of hour wait for the "already" room to be ready! There is no lobby. Only a corridor that leads down to the desk. Across from the desk (very close) was our room. We had Room 102. It was $239 + taxes. It is on the first floor in the back of the building, overlooking a courtyard. The courtyard is used by a bar next door. I understand that the owner of the Chelsea Inn allows the bar next door to use it. The west side of Chelsea Inn is a restaurant. On the east side of Chelsea inn is a bar (same owner of the restaurant.) You wouldn't know there is a bar on the west side because we didn't see any signs. You have to buzz to gain entrance. We didn't go, but wish we did. It looked like a nice place to have a glass of wine in the courtyard. It would also be a great place for guests of Chelsea Inn to eat their breakfast (since we heard that the owner of the Chelsea Inn owns the courtyard.) but appears to be unavailable to the guests. It was mostly quiet, except for the children that seemed to be occupying the unit above this one. They were noisy. The unit was large by New York standards. There was a private bathroom, small mini kitchen/dining area, a sittng area and a very small bedroom. My husband could "almost" (minus one inch) touch wall to wall. The bed has a small double bed. In the sitting area, there is a daybed, that could be used as is or pulled out into a larger bed. Because the bed in the bedroom was so small (husband is skinny but 6'2", he pretty much occupied the whole bed, so I slept in the daybed. The sitting area also had a very small television. Because the window A/C is about 5 feet away from the television you needed to turn up the televison to hear it. The channels on the television were basic cable. Nothing more. A weird note about the unit. When I was using the remote control to change channels on the television, it had to be pointed "exactly" at the television. In the morning I was haphazardly clicking channels on the television and the A/C was going off and on. On the remote control, if you clicked the UP channel (the only thing on the remote control that I found did this) and point it to the window A/C you will be turning off/on the A/C. If you switch if back to the television it will work on the television. Weird, but we tried it many times. The mini kitchen had a dorm refrigerator, a microwave and a coffeemaker (no coffee is supplied). The breakfast was supplied by the bakery underneath the Chealea Inn. It was good. A (great) coffee, fruit or a fruit juice, and a pastry. I liked it. The room is old, and about a hundered coats of paint, but still quaint and interesting. The oldness didn't bother me. Many many old b&bs are like that in Europe. 2 of the 6 candlelights in the chandelier were burned out. And at one point the lights on the fixture just popped a fuse. Luckily the fuse box was in the room, so we could just switch the fuse back on. Shower was ok.. Water was great. Didn't seem hard at all. The bathroom had a pedestal sink, which made it very difficult to lay out my toiletries in the bathroom. They would either fall on the floor or fall in the sink. The toilet was so close to the wall that you could hit the toilet paper holder. You needed to turn to sit on the toilet. There is a safe in the room. But... if it worked it didn't work according to the instructions on the wall. From the instructions... if you use the safe and you called the desk to open the safe after you put something in it and couldn't figure out how to open it, it would cost $20 for them to open it. We chose not to use it. The most disappointing part of the visit was one of the main reasons we chose this inn in the first place. Because of the internet access. It was down the entire 2 days we were there. We carted a laptop half way across the country, only for their internet service to be down. We "never" would have stayed there if we knew that. They said "sorry" and that was it. Not sure if I would stay there again because of that. Best things about the inn: Most of the desk attendents. Clean rooms Worst things about the inn: Didn't have internet service. Kinda pricey for what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Great rest spot for your stay in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: SallyandSacha
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Chelsea Inn for seven nights in February 2010 and would definately recommend staying there. Positive: All the staff that we met were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast next door at Nanaâ€™s was great and included in the rates. It is centrally located and very close to a lot of subway stations and union square. A lot of NY sights are easily walkable from here. There are some very nice restaurants nearby â€“ check out the belgian restaurant next door â€˜petite abeilleâ€™ for some really good food. Room was made everyday â€“ tv in room, bathroom facilities are very clean. We shared our bathroom with one room next to ours. The noise levels are not as bad as some reviews claim. Although the hotel is directly next to a small bar/club â€“ the noise didnt disturb us at night. Easy to get to from JFK. Wireless Internet worked well. Negative: The rooms are on the small side and the decor is very dated. It is in an old building. The view from our room was into the inner light well â€“ there was a lot of light in the room but not much of a view. Every now and then you can hear the water pipes and fridges in the rooms making noise â€“ but not very loud. Overall â€“ the Chelsea Inn is a great base for New york sight seeing, very well located hotel in the Chelsea district of Manhattan and easy to get to from the airport. If you donâ€™t mind sharing a bathroom, the rooms are quaintly decorated and the hotel is a great place to rest before taking in the amazing city of New York!

Reviews.Title: “Great place at perfect location for budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: AmitRao
Reviews.Content: The place is located at a convinient distance from the subway. The staff was very helpful and the rooms were neat and clean. Did not have any problem with the shared bath either. The only downside is that there is no elevator and my room was up on level 5 so climibing up and down especially with the luggage was an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location especially for NYU parents”
Reviews.Author: JPARTraveler
Reviews.Content: We had a large room on first floor, private bath. Our daughter was with us for one night and there was plenty of room for the functional cot. The A/C was adequate. Perfect for NYU parents; reasonable walking distance to Washington Square Park. The continental breakfast is minimal but Nana's pastries are fabulous. Staff is friendly. A very European feel. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience!”
Reviews.Author: ahuculak
Reviews.Content: The Chelsea Inn is rudimentary, but completely adequate and comfortable for a week's stay and is perfectly located for a New York City experience. My room at the back of the hotel overlooked a quiet courtyard and I never heard the "Splash" bar next door. The bathroom was shared, but no worries, everyone is very courteous and respectful. The free wireless Internet worked great on the 4th floor. Lots of stairs, but we all need the exercise! Got a Metro pass, $27.00 for the week then took buses and the subway (very safe) to anywhere I wanted to go. I travelled to Radio City Music Hall for a Peter Gabriel concert, Citi Field in Brooklyn for a Mets game, went to "Billy Elliot" on Broadway (DON'T miss this show), out to Brighton Beach and Coney Island, had a corned beef/pastrami combo at Junior's on Flatbush Ave., took the 2 hour harbour cruise and double decker bus tours with my mom and sister, saw live jazz at the "Garage" in Greenwich Village (which you can walk to) walked the Brooklyn Bridge twice (it only takes about 40 minutes) and stood next to "A Starry Night" at the MOMA. I had a blast! The staff at the Chelsea Inn were friendly, helpful and Nana's morning cheese danish, fruit and coffee got the day started perfectly! My arriving flight was delayed, I missed my connection in Minneapolis and I didn't arrive until a day after I intended... the Chelsea Inn refunded my first night's stay after I returned home upon written proof from Delta, my airline. Much appreciated! All in all if you're looking for a reasonably priced place to stay without all the expensive bells and whistles you simply can't do better than the Chelsea Inn! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in the heart of Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: Joe154976
Reviews.Content: Best value, great location. In the heart of Chelsea, close to lots of bars and restaurants, just a few minutes to several subway lines. It only took 65 mins via subway from JFK to the hotel. The staff are friendly and you get a continental breakfast too. The rooms are a bit small, but you shouldn't be wasting your time in a hotel room when Manhattan awaits. Have stayed here twice and intend staying again next year!!

Reviews.Title: “What a location!”
Reviews.Author: cootmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a queen bed 1st floor room w/private bath. It was so comfy! New decor, great linens, and the bathroom looked brand new. The front desk staff, and we met three of them, were all so friendly and helpful. The price was right - $ 179 for two! The location is primo - one of the best blocks in Chelsea for restaurants etc.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: pent19
Reviews.Content: great, quaint place! 2nd time staying there. located near 3 subways, awesome breakfast included, fridge in the rooms for leftovers. I have shared a bathroom both times with another room and wouldn't have known i was sharing with someone, get a room facing the courtyard, its quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Odet71
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my 16 year old son in a room with shared bath and never saw the other person. It's is a basic hotel with a handbasin in the room. Beds are good. The area was great for shopping near Union Square many restaurants in the area. The subway is near the hotel. Continental breakfast was great in a lovely shop below the Inn, with very kind people! When it is hot outside you get (whitout asking) Airco in your room, it's noisy but very cool. You can turn it off when you go to sleep. Good service ! There is no lift, but we stay at the 2 floor. This was no problem. Very quiet in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, clean, well located -- but get a room off the street!”
Reviews.Author: kittyCS
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay, the room was small but clean and the bathroom (shared with one other room, which appeared not to be occupied) was new and clean with a good bath and shower. The hotel has some old-world charm, albeit a little run-down. The "continental breakfast" was not much, but at least provided some coffee and a croissant to take back to the room. GREAT location -- and subway a block away. The bad -- the noise from the street was loud --there was construction going on across the way, apparently at night -- Delivery and garbage trucks in the morning -- honking periodically -- and no way to shut it out, as the air conditioner was in the window. The person at the front desk (as we were checking out) said that there are quiet rooms, you just have to ask for one!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Charm, Location, Friendly, Location, Value, Location”
Reviews.Author: hopeimaginepeace
Reviews.Content: Only had one night in NY and this was an excellent hotel. Charming, turn of the century high ceilings, tall windows overlooking a courtyard garden. My room was GIANT with bedroom, sitting room, table and mini-kitchen (microwave) and en suite bath. Some rooms are budget and have a shared hall bath as this is a converted town house that feels like a hotel with staffed front desk, breakfast included via coupon to go to adjoining bakery! EASY, easy subway access, I took the train in from Newark and walked to Times Square, walked to Central Park, walked to SoHo, walked to NYU. It was fantastic. Desk staff were friendly, offered help, suggestions, warm and inviting. I felt safe as solo female traveler and it was quiet. There should be some forgiveness, furnishings are more toward antique and functional than new and fancy-but it's done well, it feels classic not outdated. And I couldn't beat this place for value-really felt like I got more than my money's worth. This would be a fantastic place for a family as well, and it's a type of off the beaten path gem that happens to be right in the heart of the action! I got internet off someone's wifi, not the hotels. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in a quiet and central location.”
Reviews.Author: ladybug27boston
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this place. It was very clean, in a great location near some very good restaurants. The rooms were average size with a "homey" decor. My boyfriend and I stayed there for the weekend and really enjoyed it. We also found there was free parking on the weekends!

Reviews.Title: “Very average, good location but you could do better”
Reviews.Author: AlexBel1
Reviews.Content: This is a very tired, old building with dated rooms and no lift. Good location in Chelsea for walking around the Village etc. Beds were not comfortable and rooms hot and tiny. We stayed in four hostels in the city over 4 weeks and this was the worse.. and not even good value. Service is not hospitable and facilities are old and below average. You could do better!

Reviews.Title: “Great location an value.”
Reviews.Author: DWEBoston
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a room with shared bath and never saw the other person. Also had rooms with private baths. The area was great for shopping near Union Square and a very nice restaurant right next door and many restaurants in the area. I parked across the street whicih was pricy but well worh it for getting out easily in the morning. Perhaps they should work a deal for slight discount with hotel guests. Continental breakfast was great too in a nice shop below the Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: madragoa
Reviews.Content: The Chelsea Inn is good for you if you are looking for a basic room that is not too expensive to sleep in while you are out and about during the day. The staff is very friendly and helpful, the room and bathroom were clean, and the location is great, near lots of restaurants, shopping and metro stop. The breakfast at Nana's Treats, which is included in your stay, is a good continental breakfast. For the price I wasn't expecting any kind of breakfast, so this was a pleasant surprise. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for the money you're paying”
Reviews.Author: nomadphil2003
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a couple of years ago with a friend. The staff member at the reception was quite courteous and helpful. We stayed in a room on the street side of the hotel. It was a bit narrow and the old lock on the door looked as if a stiff breeze would blow it open but there was a safe in the room. There were other amenities such as a TV and fridge too. We had a shared bathroom with another room that was reasonably clean as was the room itself. There is a neighbouring gay nightclub that can be a little noisy and we were woken up by a brawl one night in the small hours of the morning outside of the club but there was no other bother other than that. The complimentary takeaway breakfast in the adjacent Mamas bakery was a nice touch where you can choose from several different pastries with a coffee and orange juice. The hotel is very well located and only a 5 minute walk to Union Square and there are loads of cafes, bars and restaurants nearby. The hotel was basic but reasonable value for the price of the room. We only wanted somewhere to sleep at night as we spent the rest of our time sightseeing, so if you want something with loads of amenities and more luxurious it's not for you. You pay your money and make your choices at the end of the day!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely quirky hotel in the big city”
Reviews.Author: DuchessEngland
Reviews.Content: My family and I enjoyed our stay here. The rooms were clean and well heated (which we needed in the sub zero temperatures outside!), the staff were really helpful and the breakfast from Mamas downstairs was just right to get the day started. It's location is lovely, not too far from the subway (about a 5 minute walk) and there's plenty of shops and restaurants in the surrounding area. The heating system was a little noisy during the night but then it is an old building! As the purpose of our trip was to see New York we didn't really want to pay the prices you get in the 'luxury' hotels as we didn't intend to stay in the hotel for long!

Reviews.Title: “Don't trust their quotes”
Reviews.Author: ducky1980
Reviews.Content: I got on their website and wanted to get a quote for the room, which I did. The sent me a price for the stay of the room and the description, I called to make the reservation and OH....they made a mistake and misquoted the room, so they can't honor their quote. They offered nothing but sorry, but we can't do that price right now."

Reviews.Title: “The Ultimate Dump”
Reviews.Author: goldenrule34
Reviews.Content: If you like filthy bedding, filthy room, no hot water, extreme heat in rooms (No thermostat), no wake up calls or alarm clocks, rude service at the promised continental breakfast, loud night club next door, no staff presence at night, AND THEY MAKE YOU PAY UPFRONT!!! Then this place is for you. This place is a real dump. It seems as though we were the only people staying here. We were to stay for two nights. The experience was so bad that we left after one night and they would not refund the balance because the manager was not available. We called to talk to management for refund afterwards. They would not permit us to talk to manager, nor has manager returned our messages.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you really need”
Reviews.Author: Chasmo13
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean rooms, friendly staff. If you're just playing tourist and the point is to be in New York, not sitting around the room, it's got everything you really need, at very decent price. Not for everyone, but we were all quite happy. Being on the same block as two good restaurants and an inexpensive Belgian Cafe was a plus, too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with big room, neat and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: olyflipe
Reviews.Content: The room was pretty big, bed very confortable. The price was correct, you even have a breakfast include which is definitively not every time the case in the New York Hotel. Its not too far from Time square by foot. (25 mintues). You can also walk easily to the greenwitch village which is the right place to go if you want to party with new yorker. The only bad point was that my room was on the first floor and next to it there is a club. So it was a little bit noisy from this side of this hotel. I will recommend it but ask for a room upstair.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot and great value”
Reviews.Author: amjl
Reviews.Content: Spend 4 days in NYC in early Dec, and stayed at the Chelsea Inn. Some members of the party (4) had a few worries beforehand after seeing mixed reviews on the web. However expectations were not too high to begin with and though first impressions were not positive for some of the women in the party, by the 2nd night everything was fine. The hotel is old and relatively basic, but then it is NYC, many other hotels are exactly the same and if you going to be out and about for most of the day, you are not looking for a spa/sauna here when you get back. The rooms have all the essentials: safe, fridge, dressers, TV, good bed. We stayed in a "suite" so we had 2 rooms adjacent to each other, a small "hall" with its own door (so the rooms were separated from the other rooms in the hotel) and our own bathroom that was shared between the rooms. The bathroom was fine: tiled, large, usual US shower that wakes you up like nothing else. The street outside was pretty noisy during the night. This is probably related a lot to sleeping patterns being confused by the travel, as both couples woke around 3am the first night (which would have been 8am in Europe for us, so normal getting up time !) and hence then found the noise difficult when trying to get back to sleep. There was some building work in a nearby building and the guys seemed to be getting some delivery during the night of skips or something similar (that was just noisy when being dropped off and being dragged a few yards). At the weekend the noise dissipated a lot and sleep came better. Did not hear much of the gay night club down the street and did not feel that it made the area seedy or anything like that. There was never any problem coming or going at any hour of the evening or night. The breakfast at the little shop at the entrance to the hotel is grand to start you off on your day (OJ, pastry, tea/coffee) - try the cheese filled Danishes - they are really nice. Overall the value was excellent, the location was ideal (very easy to walk anywhere) and the quality of the hotel was perfectly adequate for a short stay in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Near Subway, dodgy WiFi”
Reviews.Author: ssinha1981
Reviews.Content: It's a good place and right next to a 14th St. subway (connection to JFK). Only trouble we had - internet/WiFi from our room (#207) was weak .. but worked every now and then. I could handle my tasks at home (South Africa) ..

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in a cool area of the city - New York is awesome”
Reviews.Author: InsideJapanJim
Reviews.Content: We were looking for somewhere cheapish to stay but in a good location of the city and found it in the Chelsea Inn Hotel. The Hotel sits in Greenwhich Village down a quiet street but with subways, shops, restaurants, diners, bars and the sights all just a stones throw away. The rooms were pretty good, clean and big enough and we were sharing a bathroom with one other room. The bathroom was very nice and clean too. There was a good little breakfast included which was enough to set you on your way for a day in NYC. The staff were pretty friendly and helpful as most people seem to be in NY. I would be pleased to stay here again and save a bit of cash to enjoy in this excellent ciy.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location,location”
Reviews.Author: Rambp300
Reviews.Content: For the price, perfect; helpful staff, minimalist. Right above splash, easy transportation. Nice continental breakfast

Reviews.Title: “great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Richard1965Belgium
Reviews.Content: Small but very clean room. We had a private bathroom, but the only disadvantage was to stay on the top floor ( 5th). (In a hotel without an elevator this can be very tough, but at the same time it provided a good workout at the and of the day!) The internet connection did not always work in our room,so we had to sit on the stairs like some other guests did. The staff was very friendly! There is a bar next to the hotel, so sometimes it can be a bit noisy. At the other side there is a great restaurant where they serve a selection of belgian beers and meals. At arrival you get vouchers for breakfast which you can get in a small store in the basement of the hotel. The location of the hotel was very good, only a short walk away from 2 subway stations.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: ama78guy
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with the room and location. It was my first time in NYC so I was expecting a much smaller room and never shared a bathroom before, but the room was bigger than expected and had no issues whatsoever with the bathroom situation. I was sick for my whole vacation so I ended up spending more time in my room than I would have liked but it was very clean and quaint. Staff was nice, the pastry shop downstairs was very good. Better continental breakfast than most places I've been anywhere actually. Subway is a block away, drugstore and restaurants on the same block or within a 5 min walk. Really liked Creme I believe it was called next block down on 17th. Great bar next door depending on what night it is (don't go on Monday if you don't like show-tunes). So even if you get sick plenty to do right around the hotel. Only thing I can say that had room for improvement would be the internet situation. I only got a signal one night out of four in my room and it was kind of late at night. I stayed on the fifth floor, so it can be sort of understandable, but I met some kids staying on the third who said they didn't get a signal the first night they were there. I actually met them while on the stairs using my laptop and we all went out and had a great time that night so the wireless signal strength actually ended up being a good thing in the end, but yeah a wi-fi signal booster would be a good thing guys! So to sum this up, I don't think you can beat this place for the price. I stayed for four days and could have easily stayed there for another week!

Reviews.Title: “Chelsea Inn, a real treasure”
Reviews.Author: heerwestra
Reviews.Content: For seven nights we slept at this lovely inn. We really liked the atmosphere of our room, it gave us a cozy feeling. The location was perfect, close to a lot of subwaystations and Union Square. When we arrived at the Chelsea Inn the frontdesk was closed, but how nice was it to see a note attached to the frontdoor with your name on it, giving us instructions about what to do next. What can we say about the service...the rooms were always tidy and they arranged a great taxi to Newark Airport. One thing about the internetconnection, in our room it was impossible to use internet. We had to sit on the straircase to be connected. One piece of advice: with all the travellers from Europe staying at your inn, have a some wallsocketplugs so we can use/charge our European electronic devices. Even with instructions of the reception it was very hard to find one on our own. We would most certainly come back!

Reviews.Title: “So Charming...Like We Were in a Victorian House From an Old Novel”
Reviews.Author: HollyGo_SF
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Chelsea Inn. It really feels like you are renting a room in a home in circa 1890's New York. Our expectations weren't high as we knew this wasn't a Hilton, but we were pleasantly surprised with this little gem. The check-in was smooth and easy. The nice lady named Melissa offered to make us dinner reservations if we were hungry and gave us a free copy of Time Out New York magazine to help us plan our time there. We were way up on the fourth floor and since there is not an elevator...carrying our 50lbs. bag up the stairs was not an easy task. Once we got to our room,,,we loved how homey it felt. Nice big window, tall ceilings and a quilted bed. There was also a sink and a mini refrigerator which was very nice to have. Free Wi-Fi was also a plus. Sharing a bathroom with another room was no problem at all. We never saw the other people and it was always very clean. In the morning, you are given coupons to the downstairs nook of a bakery called Nana's Treats. You get coffee, a pastry and a piece of fruit every day of your stay. (I recommend the cinnamon rolls) The little breakfast helped us save a few bucks each day. The location was perfect. Only two blocks from Union Square. SO many restaurants on the hotel's street alone and only half a block from awesome shopping: H&M, Kate Spade, Zara etc. There are two clubs near the Inn but from our room, we couldn't hear any noise.
