I also felt safer knowing there were always people hanging out or waiting in line to get into the clubs when we got back to the hotel late late in the evening. Check-out was just as smooth and a very kind and patient woman named Rada answered our last minute questions. All in all, I loved it here. But don't go in looking for a chain high-end hotel experience. It is for those adventurous travelers that don't like to feel simply like a tourist, but like you are living as a local for a short stay. We will certainly stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: stutravel
Reviews.Content: We ended up at the Chelsea because we were desperate and it was the only place we could find in NYC at the time at very short notice. We have stayed at half a four different places in the city so my judgement is not based on a big sample. Having said that it was OK. I thought it was a little overpriced for what we got elswhere. The rooms are tidy and clean, the woman running the counter was very charming and pleseant. At night though it was really noising becing located close to what i think might have been a gay nightclub. The noise in the streets below seemed to go on all night. The old aircon seemed to have a lot of mould so we were disinclined to put t on and so in ended up being quite stuffy. It aint the Hilton but it was OK and the location was good.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't want to stay too long”
Reviews.Author: NewOrleansGary
Reviews.Content: The location is great. As someone previously said "It's a place to sleep." The staff seemed disinterested and housekeeping left much to be desired. That said, the sheets were clean, there is a television with a wierd selection of channels, bed is sleepable and really firm. The bottom floor back room I stayed in (#105) was somewhat noisy as it is above the patio. The breakfast pastries were quite good. If your not to picky and an easy traveler it's OK.

Reviews.Title: “Hey, It's a place to sleep!”
Reviews.Author: gordon fan
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Chelsea Inn one Saturday night in July. One of our friends was getting married and we had her bachelorette party in the city. When I first heard we were going to the city, I immediately was on Trip Advisor looking for something decent. So, I sent my friend who was coordinating this party 2 or 3 hotels that had decent reviews and weren't outrageously expensive but this was not one of them. Anyway, she booked this hotel because there were 8 of us and the man on the phone said the 5th floor has 4 bedrooms and 2 baths and would be perfect for us for a great price I might add. So, after reading reviews on Trip Advisor I was like oh boy. I really didn't want to stay here but I was not in charge and she was trying to keep it cheap. We were warned that there was no elevator so climbing to the 5th floor was an adventure! When we got there, the person at the desk said oh I have 3 rooms on the 5th floor and 1 on the 1st floor. The whole point of the discount and us staying together was obviiously to be together well after hemming and hawwing the woman all of a sudden said let me see what I can do and all of a sudden the 4th room on the 5th floor was available...weird! Anyway, the rooms were ok, plain but clean! Bathroom...plain but clean! There was AC which worked great in some rooms but not so great in others. There was a fridge there which was great for soda and water. The cafe next store is awesome and so quaint. Try their belgian waffles, they're to die for! One problem we did have was that the hotel had 2 entrances and after a night out none of us realized that we went into the wrong entrance until after we walked up to the 5th floor only to see what was NOT our room. So, we walked all the way back down and all the way up to get to our rooms. Our fault, but just be careful and watch the entrances. I heard no noise coming from a club so I'm not sure what everyone is talking about with previous reviews. We all did get a free voucher for breakfast which was outside and down in a very little cafe where you can get coffee, juice and pastries, that was ok, the cafe next door is better though. All in all the Chelsea Inn wasn't as bad as I thought, I probably wouldn't stay there again unless I was heading down there with the girls again. It was nice being the only ones on our floor getting ready for our big night out. But hey, it's a place to sleep for the night right?

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Neighboring Gay Bar”
Reviews.Author: snejdl
Reviews.Content: I have few complaints about this hotel but I recommend to avoid room 106 if possible. The neighboring gay bar/club is open every night (even Sunday & Monday!) and you'll hear the boom boom boom through the walls unless you tun on the noisy air conditioner unit by your window. The A/C doesn't make the room cold but it drowns out street noise and if angled right can blow cool air on you. We were fortunate to be on the first floor avoiding the stairs- there's no elevator. The room lacks an alarm clock (but who needs that these days anyway), hair dryer, coffee maker and other regular features of hotel rooms. The staff isn't there at all hours but when they are there, they are friendly and ready to help in any way. The price is very reasonable considering the proximity to Union Square, two subway entrances and, of course, a gay bar. In the day, there is minimal traffic making this a NY-quiet neighborhood. (Sirens, trucks and trash pick up are noisy everywhere) I personally enjoyed my stay and have no real complaints (I'm easy to please and don't need much for comfort) but I can see where several people I know would be less than comfortable, which is why I'll probably not recommend this place unless they are on a tight budget. They do have free wi-fi for guests though our signal was very low. They may be our room location or wireless card though. My favorite perk: there's a wonderful cafe next door called Petite Abielle that offers decent, low priced food in a quaint, quiet, cozy atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “good, clean accommodation in a great location”
Reviews.Author: WeloveNYC
Reviews.Content: Before the trip:- We booked our room through Hostel Bookers, which I would not do again (I would book with the hotel direct) but we received a confirmation of the booking from the Chelsea Inn and from this we were able to ask them to make a dinner reservation for us, which they happily did. Check-in was very easy and we stayed in room 201. The room was fairly large, with a shared bath. Both the bathroom and the bedroom were kept very clean, with fresh towels and our room made up daily. Our rooom was front facing and on some nights it was noisy but we were too exhausted to let it bother us and we were in New York City so to us it was part of the trip. The Inn is located two blocks away from Union Square and there are many subway stations within easy walking distance. Included in the stay, you are given a complimentary continental breakfast voucher for a small take-away coffee shop/deli which is located just underneath the Inn. We had breakfast from here on each morning of our trip. Due to our late return flight, we asked to leave our luggage, which we were able to do but we had to be back to reclaim it by 7.00pm even though reception was open until 9.00pm which meant that we had to return to the Inn earlier than we would have liked. Perhaps the Inn could be more flexible on this? Overall, myself and my husband were happy with the accommodation at Chelsea Inn and would recommend it if you are looking for basic, clean accommodation in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Charged for damage we didn't cause - avoid”
Reviews.Author: dEVIii
Reviews.Content: This place has the most outrageously presumptuous management of any place I've ever stayed at. I was charged for breaking a table and even after a lengthy discussion with the management they would not believe that me and my friends did not break it. I just cant believe the amount of trouble they caused me. I guess the place could be fine if the management happens to like you... You just better not get in their way. AVOID!

Reviews.Title: “liked it very much!”
Reviews.Author: gossamermoonspider
Reviews.Content: easy to find, easy to park and take our bags in. people at the front desk were very friendly! they helped us find restaurants, shops, basically everything. our room was sooo cute, but a bit hot. it got kind of loud one night with the gay bar down the street, but i fell back asleep, so it wasn't bad. it was in a great neighborhood, too. i would definitely recommend! also, the breakfast was delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money, better than expected”
Reviews.Author: laurethazn
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a single night because I just needed a place to crash between the bars and sight seeing. The front desk closes by 9PM which Expedia.com failed to mention when I called to arrange my visit at 9:20pm so when I got there they had no Idea who I was or that I had a reservation but the gentleman who watched the establishment at night hooked me up with a room so I wasn't out on my own and the next morning John and Elaina were very good at figuring it all out for me. I didn't have any problems with bugs and to be completely honest if you are looking for a place to provide anything more than a place to sleep for a few hours after a night on the town you don't go to a place in this price range. I will go back again the next time I visit and make arrangements earlier. They even gave me a voucher for the little pastry shop under the inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.... we were only in the room to sleep”
Reviews.Author: TokraDOG
Reviews.Content: My family (mum, dad and two kids (11 and 17 yrs) stayed at the Chelsea Inn for 10 nights (including Christmas). We had no problems with noise. We have a back room (on the ground flood opposite the reception desk). We didn't hear a peep from the gay night club a few doors down and didn't realize it was there until we walked past it on the last night! But then again it was winter and all the door and windows were closed. We eat a lot the at the little Tin Tin themed restaurant new door... yummy yummy food. The bathroom was small but adequate. I was worried about being cold but the room was so hot it was like a sauna. We did have lots problems with the Inn's internet connection ..... u must purchase an internet card.... and most times we could not log on. The day staff were mostly friendly. The kitchenette was next to useless. Yes we did have a sink and jug but no crockery or cutlery of any description. I wasn't disappointed with our stay.... it was as I expected thanks to trip advisor reviews... Overall the hotel is small, old, dark, mostly cleanish & the decor dated ... as is much of the older style accommodation in NY. It was a FANTASTIC location. Close to Union Square and shopping. We only used the Metro in NY and felt perfectly safe at all times. Would I stay there again? Probably not. Next time I go to NY will be in summer, without the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, smelly, tatty little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Completetosh
Reviews.Content: The Chelsea's website suggests a "charming" and "renovated" townhouse hotel, with slightly odd furnishings but a great location and budget appeal. The location bit is accurate, the rest not so much. A colleague and I took neighboring fifth floor rooms, planning to share a bathroom. The rooms were tatty, cramped, smelly and hot. My friend got bitten by insects while, outside, a noisy nightclub kept a steady flow of partygoers and horn-happy taxi drivers going until 4.30am. Only then could we sleep. The staff were friendly enough when we checked out four nights early, but unless you're in NYC to go clubbing, I'd seriously suggest you avoid yourself the grief, and book elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Cute room, but window faced the street..”
Reviews.Author: klidzz
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked this hotel because it was in our budget compared to all the other hotels around the area. We thought we were getting a shared bathroom but turns out someone had cancelled and so we upgraded to one with a private bathroom. We paid cash, and were not informed on the website that there is a security deposit also, which is the same amount for the night we stayed, so we paid double the amount and almost did not have enough to even stay. Hotel staff worked in on us being intimate, they were not aware the room was booked i assume. We got back to the hotel rather late, and wanted to sleep but there is a gay bar right down the street and it was constantly loud. we heard some loud noises and my boyfriend decided to baracade the door so that we felt safe (they have crappy locks) but overall great price, very cute room, big windows and lots of space to move around. but it all depends on what rooms they have ready. we had the room right about the cafe on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, but extremely noisy.”
Reviews.Author: saunterer30
Reviews.Content: Chelsea Inn has a pleasant staff, rooms are fine, but it is extremely noisy---even for NY. Loud trucks right outside the window in the middle of the night, people yelling and fighting from the nightclub very late at night---even earplugs were little help. After two nights of little sleep my husband and I mentioned this to the deskperson---but not much they could do. We stayed several nights, just because there weren't many options during the Christmas season. Unless the management could assure us of a quiet room---we would not return. Except for the noise the location is great, continental breakfast is fine, but fruit salad in a container would beat green apples everyday. Pastries were just fine. The price is reasonable, but if you want enough quiet to sleep---spend the extra $$ on a hotel. It's a nice option if you are on a tight budget, but with no compensation for lack of sleep, it leaves one disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Legeelan
Reviews.Content: Was a bit concerned about staying in Chelsea Inn after reading the reviews here but I found it to be a really nice place. The walk up the stairs with the luggage was about the only issue I had. The rooms are "quaint" but very clean and warm and I was aware of the shared bathroom before booking. The bathroom was only shared between 2 rooms and was also spotles. The staff were friendly and check in efficient. I was a travelling alone on both occasions I stayed at the Chelsea Inn and I felt the place was safe and secure. The location is also excellent About 15 minutes walk to Times Square and just around the corner from Union Square with all its restaurants and access to the Subway I would certainly stay again. Good value for the price and the breakfast is an added bonus from the bakery in the basement

Reviews.Title: “nice if you like mice”
Reviews.Author: MatildaZuerich
Reviews.Content: I had to book a hotel room at very late notice and this hotel was the only hotel available for a room rate below 180USD. I paid 149USD for a tiny single bed room with a shared bath. The carpet was sticky, so where all the appliances in the room. The bed linen was clean (not so much for the bed cover, which had a cigarette burn hole). Breakfast has to be picked-up at the bakery stall in the basement, where it is a mess and you do not want to know, how it looks like in the kitchen. Beside that no place to sit down for breakfast. So, why not directly go to the City Bakery (affordable breakfast in a nice & clean athmosphere). Then there are mice. The second night I constantly woke up because I heard noices. The next morning I noticed the mice at from my apple and when I got home, I had mice poo in my suitcase.. Next time I spend the 30USD more for the cleanliness of a Holiday Inn. Not great either, but at least there will be no other "inofficial" guest.

Reviews.Title: “Low price, low value”
Reviews.Author: younggaycouple
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed there for a week. It was not our first time in Manhattan, and we have been wholly satisfied by other, cheaper or same price, hotels in Chelsea or other neighborhood. This time, all we could find for our budget was the Chelsea Inn. Overall, we could say our stay was ok, but that is all. Avoid rooms on street side: quite a lot of noise from customers of Splash nightclub, garbage trucks or fire trucks passing by, almost all nights. Add to this someone who played with the intercom, ringing our room in the middle of the night (what is the point of having an intercom in a hotel???), well we had a few sleeping problems... The room was indeed very large compared to what we were used to, but the carpet is old and stained. We saw at least one mouse rushing through our room. The sink in our room was barely working. The place is somewhat smelly, like an old hotel with old carpets everywhere. Nonetheless, the shared bathroom was spotless, as well as the bed and bedsheets. As for the TV, it was the worst selection of stations we ever saw: if you want to look at the TV Guide Network, you have it thirty times. Otherwise, all you have are local tv stations who seem to care only about local murders or robberies, as well as all kind of rreality shows. We were not in Manhattan to look at the TV, but it would have been interesting to be able to have international news... Breakfast is ok, but you can find a lot better in the neighborhood. If you can't find another hotel, Chelsea Inn is better than nothing, but there are better cheap accomodations in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Chelsea Inn”
Reviews.Author: dusterbug
Reviews.Content: Our Stay at the Chelsea Inn could not have been more comfortable and hospitable. We wee greeted by very nice employees. We had a delicious danish every morning and the beds were unbelievably comfortable. next time I go to New York, the Chelsea Inn is the first place I will call. The location is great and the price is very reasonable. Our stay was very memorable thanks to the Chelsea Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Great Price - Great Location - Great Service”
Reviews.Author: maritime_girl1979
Reviews.Content: We stayed here our first night in New York and it was wonderful. The room was clean...we had more than enough hot water for showers...the staff were friendly and I would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great price for NYC”
Reviews.Author: sfrunner
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, comfortable, safe, and the right price. The staff was very friendly and helped me carry my luggage up the many flights of stairs. We didn't have any issues with noise (but we're cityfolk) and the shared bathrooms were very clean. In fact, we never even saw our neighbors. We didn't want to spend all of our money on a room we only needed to store our stuff and sleep in. Free wireless and a Pinkberry across the street--bonus! I would definitely stay here again. Well located and well priced.

Reviews.Title: “Good little budget hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Chinster_UK
Reviews.Content: We were in New York on a budget and the Chelsea Inn fit the bill perfectly. The rooms, though small were fine, with a wash basin inside and a shared bathroom. To be honest all we wanted was somewhere to lay our heads in peace each night as we were out from early each day until late. No point paying mega bucks for something we didn't need. We had no problems with the shared bathroom, it's only shared with one other room anyway. Stairs up to the 3rd floor were fine too, unless you are old or have trouble walking. I found the Chelsea Inn to have a lot of character and we don't regret our choice of accommodation at all. Union Square tube station is just around the corner (feed the squirrels!). Empire State Building is a 10-15 min walk away, and you get a great view of it as you approach the hotel from Union Square. Breakfast from Nana's was a tasty treat. If you want to go to NY on a budget and just need somewhere tidy to lay your head then I can't recommend this enough. It's in a superb location too. If you're used to being pampered in your hotel then this isn't the place for you. Would I use it again if I were in NY? Sure would!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: Peg630
Reviews.Content: I actually haven't stayed at Chelsea Inn and will now never will. I booked a room for 4 nights for end of April 3 weeks ago and got a call today from Yousef that he will be cancelling my reservation because he overbooked. He explained "My boss told me today to cancel your reservation because I neglected to see the extra spots avaliable on the days I booked has already been reserved to hotels.com". I desperately asked if there is anything he could do he coldly said no, although I can go online to hotels.com now and book it through them for $50 extra per night. I am extremely upset because I made the effort to book the accomodation early enough (10 weeks ahead) to ensure availbility & lowest price (prices are jacked up when you reserve last minute) - if I was told 3 weeks ago that they are all booked up I would've been able to take advantage of the one day 30% discount on expedia.com rather now I have just wasted my last 5 hours trying to find a new affordable accomodation which everywhere is booked up and I might have to stay at Best Western for $350 a night. Inn keeper should've at least try to make other arrangement for me ex. Give me one of the spots hotels.com is holding because this is their fault not mine. Guess they couldn't careless if they loss a customer. I'm running out of words to express my anger. Will not ever stay in Chelsea Inn and will not recommend it to anyone due to poor service.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: plkme
Reviews.Content: it's taken me a while to finally write this review. however, now again seeking accommodations in nyc, i am reminded how awful my last experience was. stayed 2 nights at the chelsea inn. my husband and another couple with whom we travelled were quite disappointed at the entire experience. the staff were indifferent to say the least. the price was around $180 per night for each of 2 rooms (one couple in each) which shared a bath. the rooms were shabby and dark and the lights weren't working properly. the "pastries" which we had to retrieve at the bakery (separate entrance from the hotel) were stale. there were no accommodations at the bakery or the hotel for eating them with our coffee, like a dining room or cafe. so we had to take them up to our depressing rooms. requiring an additional walk up the flights of stairs... ...bringing me to the real topper of the hotel...we were on the third floor and it was a WALK-UP with narrow, steep stairs. when we made our reservations over the phone, no one asked if a third or fourth floor trek would be okay. no mention of "we don't have an elevator". when we discovered this challenge, quite distressed, we went to the desk to explain that members of our party were older and my husband has heart and breathing problems and the stairs were too difficult. they made clear that it was just our tough luck and they couldn't do a thing about it. (we did notice that there were first floor rooms that were empty) we ended up attempting to minimize the number of times we walked up to the rooms AND, each time, we had to take several breaks to make it up the next section. so, i will NEVER stay here again and recommend that, unless you want to pay a good amount for bad service, dreary, semi-clean accommodations, try to avoid this place. there are many better for the price in nyc.

Reviews.Title: “safe place to stay”
Reviews.Author: btaylorFla
Reviews.Content: Wow what a great price for new york city $145.00 a night but you do get what you pay for. but the room is clean but the stairs to your room are a killer!!!! they are old and small and very steep, I would ask for a room on the bottom floor next time. The location is great, we are two girls traveling alone and we always felt safe there, the room is very loud on the weekends its not the hotel thats loud its the apts around the hotel but other than that we were very happy. If you can afford more money there maybe better places to stay but most of the small hotels are old like this one in nyc, so we feel like we paid a fare rate..we did not spend much time in the hotel anyways so its a good place to sleep. but if your looking for more this is not the place for you. We will stay there again, there is great places to eat and some fun bars around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Chelsea Inn - real New York living”
Reviews.Author: Starshaped_99
Reviews.Content: The Chelsea Inn is a FABULOUS place to stay in New York if you are on a budget. It is a beautiful old building, typical New York style over many floors. We stayed for a week just before Christmas 2007 and couldn't have asked for a nicer place to stay. We found it to be like a 3 star budget hotel. It was very quiet and we felt like we were staying in our very own apartment in NYC. The room was large with a TV and fridge (great if you are on a budget) with a sink in the room, and a bathroom shared onyl between us and one other room. The staff were friendly and accomodating. I have seen reviews where people say their bedroom door was left unlocked after cleaning - this happened to us on the first day aswell, but we simply found the maid, asked her if she could make sure our room was locked after she'd finished each day, and it was without fail. The breakfasts are yummy and again - typically New York. You get a tea/coffee, fruit juice and freshly baked pastry. The lady in the breakfast place is really nice if you are nice/polite to her, and she makes all her own pastries and cakes which are delicious! Overall we had a GREAT stay at this place. Clean, quiet, spacious, relaxed and atmospheric, we felt like we were real New Yorkers in our own little apartment. Oh, and the location is fantastic. Right between 5th and 6th Ave, near to several Subway lines, walkable to Times Square - PERFECT!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Mai83
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chelsea Inn over the holidays and truly enjoyed our stay. The hotel was nice and has a lot of character, a lot nicer than all those chain hotels. We stayed there in two parts and both times our room was really nice. The shared bathroom wasn't a problem, like many, we didn't see much of the other people sharing the toilet, probably once or twice. The location is very good indeed, two subway stations really nearby and trains take you right in the heart of midtown. Chelsea itself is enjoyable too, lots to see and do. The often mentioned nightclub downstairs didn't bother us, once we heard the thumping of the bass, but got over it. All in all, our stay was really very good. We will definetely recommend Chelsea Inn for anyone who asks. Perfect cute get away from the hustle and bustle of the busy city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at Chelsea Inn”
Reviews.Author: BronxCarolina
Reviews.Content: I read so many reviews about this hotel before booking our reservations and they really made me nervous. However, after staying there myself, I feel that this hotel has been showed in an unfair light. I recognize that people are different and have different expectations, but being a native New Yorker, in town for a "back to my homeland" getaway, I knew that the room would not be huge, but I found everything to my liking. Granted, there was some noise at night, but I am a light sleeper so I sleep with ear plugs in and didn't hear a thing all night once I put them in. If you don't want noise at night, you shouldn't stay one block off of 5th Avenue in NYC, period. Contrary to some other reviews, my husband and I came in contact with 4 different front desk people, all of whom were exceedingly delightful, helpful and friendly. The stairs are a killer and the paint is chipped in places, but this is a 19th century historic building, what do you expect? If you want modern, top of the line lodging, stay at the Plaza and pay the extra money. I found the atmosphere to be quaint and comfortable. The Belgian restaurant next door was a little tiny place, but had some of the best food I have ever eaten. I would definitely stay here again and had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the price”
Reviews.Author: chairbear46
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here Dec. 28th thru the New Year's eve. Considering that most hotels around this time were going for $300+, this place is a relative bargain given its excellent location. Great restaurants, art galleries, shopping and the subway are nearby. The room was clean and avg sized, and we never saw the other people in our shared bathroom. The only problem was that the street noise can be loud at times. However it didn't really bother us, as we always stayed out late every night and passed out pretty quickly upon returning to our room. Besides, who comes to NYC to sleep?

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and simple”
Reviews.Author: Frigg
Reviews.Content: I was a bit nervous after having read a few bad reviews, but I was quite relieved when the place turned out to be clean and comfortable. The staff is friendly and relaxed. The room made me feel quite nostalgic, it was like being a student again with a shared bathroom and simple kitchen equipment. The interior looks as if it has been purchased at a flee market or a grandmothers yard sale, and suites the whole 19th century feel of the building. If you are reasonably fit, the steep stairs shouldn't be a problem. There are safes in the room, which I thought was a great plus. So is the location, which is "close to everywhere". The breakfasts at Nana's Treats were delicious and a nice alternative to traditional hotel breakfasts. I'll consider staying here again next time I'm in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: RalphMelbourne
Reviews.Content: After I read the reviews I was a bit reluctant - but i found the place great, great location, friendly adn helpful staff, stairs creak, but I was on the 5th Floor (only had one bag) and the stairs were good exercise. Room decor eccentric but clean and bright, shared bathroom, which I knew when I booked, was clean. As a single person travelling it was perfect as a base. Nanna's treats are great for breakfast, particularly the raisin bagels. Overall, if you want a reasonable price, aren't too fussy this is a place to stay. Cheers Ralph

HotelInfo.Name: Chelsea Inn - 17th Street
HotelInfo.Address: 46 West 17th Street, New York City, NY 10011
